required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Safety and Tolerability of BSCT (Anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Phase 1 Investigation of the Safety and Tolerability of BSCT (Anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment When Applied Twice Daily for 28 Days in Male and Female Patients With Basal Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, open-label, single-arm, multicenter study to assess the safety and tolerability of BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment in subjects with BCC.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the trial was to determine the safety and tolerability of BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days in male and female patients with BCC; and to determine the steady-state pharmacokinetics (PK) of the active pharmaceutical ingredient (total sheep Immunoglobulin G [IgG]) when BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment is applied twice daily to BCC lesions. This was an open-label, single-arm, multicenter Phase 1 study that enrolled 21 BCC patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (Safety and Tolerability)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events and any changes in physical examinations will be monitored, as described in the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 21 Part 312. In particular local cutaneous irritation including erythema, peeling, dryness, itching, and burning/ stinging that first occur during the study or represent a worsening from Baseline will be recorded as AEs.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Measure Serum Concentration of Total Sheep IgG Using an ELISA.
primary_outcome.description: To determine PK, blood levels of sheep IgG were measured in samples collected at Visit 2 (Baseline), Visit 5, predose at Visit 6 (EOT), and then at 1 h, 2 h, and 4 h after the last dose of study medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Measure Subject Antibody Response to the Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient Using an Indirect Fluorescent Immuno Assay.
primary_outcome.description: The active ingredient of BSCT is sheep IgG which may causes an immunogenic response if it enters the systemic circulation. To monitor this response patient blood samples collected at Screening, Visit 2 (Baseline), Visit 6 (EOT), and at Visit 8 (EOS) was tested for anti-sheep IgG antibodies (indicative of immune response against API).

arm_group.description: 21 patients with BCC were treated with BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days.

intervention.description: The study product BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment was anti-nf-P2X7 (highly purified sheep IgG) in an ointment formulation for topical administration. The formulation contained 10% weight by weight of the active pharmaceutical ingredient in an anhydrous ointment base. Fifty (50) to 100 mg of product (an amount the size of a small pea) was applied topically twice a day for 28 days to a 25 cm2 area of skin containing a single BCC lesion. The product was to be applied in the morning and in the evening after washing.

group.title: Treatment With BSCT
group.description: BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days

group.description: BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (Safety and Tolerability)
outcome.description: Adverse events and any changes in physical examinations will be monitored, as described in the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 21 Part 312. In particular local cutaneous irritation including erythema, peeling, dryness, itching, and burning/ stinging that first occur during the study or represent a worsening from Baseline will be recorded as AEs.
outcome.population: All (21 of 21) subjects returned for safety and tolerability assessments at days 3, 8, 15 and 29 post-Baseline. 20 of 21 patients returned for final safety assessments was at 57 days post-Baseline.

group.title: Treatment With BSCT
group.description: BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days post baseline to all subjects. All (21 of 21) subjects returned for safety and tolerability assessments at days 3, 8, 15 and 29 post-Baseline. 20 of 21 patients returned for final safety assessments at 57 days post-Baseline.

measure.title: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (Safety and Tolerability)
measure.description: Adverse events and any changes in physical examinations will be monitored, as described in the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 21 Part 312. In particular local cutaneous irritation including erythema, peeling, dryness, itching, and burning/ stinging that first occur during the study or represent a worsening from Baseline will be recorded as AEs.
measure.population: All (21 of 21) subjects returned for safety and tolerability assessments at days 3, 8, 15 and 29 post-Baseline. 20 of 21 patients returned for final safety assessments was at 57 days post-Baseline.

class.title: Subjects with any Serious Adverse Events

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics - Measure Serum Concentration of Total Sheep IgG Using an ELISA.
outcome.description: To determine PK, blood levels of sheep IgG were measured in samples collected at Visit 2 (Baseline), Visit 5, predose at Visit 6 (EOT), and then at 1 h, 2 h, and 4 h after the last dose of study medication.
outcome.population: At all timepoints, the serum concentration of sheep IgG was too low to be quantified in most of the subjects. One subject had measurable sheep IgG at 1 hr post dose at Visit 6 (EOT) and 3 other subjects had measurable sheep IgG at predose timepoints. In outcome measure below NA represents readings less than lower limit of quantification.

group.description: BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days

measure.population: At all timepoints, the serum concentration of sheep IgG was too low to be quantified in most of the subjects. One subject had measurable sheep IgG at 1 hr post dose at Visit 6 (EOT) and 3 other subjects had measurable sheep IgG at predose timepoints. In outcome measure below NA represents readings less than lower limit of quantification.

measurement_list.measurement: All patients had levels of sheep IgG below limit of quantitation.
The majority of patients had levels of sheep IgG below limit of quantitation.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics - Measure Subject Antibody Response to the Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient Using an Indirect Fluorescent Immuno Assay.
outcome.description: The active ingredient of BSCT is sheep IgG which may causes an immunogenic response if it enters the systemic circulation. To monitor this response patient blood samples collected at Screening, Visit 2 (Baseline), Visit 6 (EOT), and at Visit 8 (EOS) was tested for anti-sheep IgG antibodies (indicative of immune response against API).
outcome.population: Anti sheep IgG antibody titres were measured from 21 subjects at screening and baseline, 20 subjects at Visit 6 (Day 29 EOT) and 19 subjects at Visit 8 (Day 57 follow up). The percentage of patients with detectable anti sheep antibodies is reported.

To monitor this response patient blood samples collected at Screening, Visit 2 (Baseline), Visit 6 (EOT), and at Visit 8 (EOS) was tested for anti-sheep IgG antibodies (indicative of immune response against API).
measure.population: Anti sheep IgG antibody titres were measured from 21 subjects at screening and baseline, 20 subjects at Visit 6 (Day 29 EOT) and 19 subjects at Visit 8 (Day 57 follow up). The percentage of patients with detectable anti sheep antibodies is reported.

outcome.title: Change in Lesion Size.
outcome.description: BCC lesion area was measured at Baseline and after 28 days treatment. Percantage change in lesion area was caculated.
outcome.population: Final area of lesion was not recorded for one subject.

reported_events.time_frame: 8 weeks (28 day treatment period and 28 day follow up period).
reported_events.desc: All (21 of 21) subjects returned for safety and tolerability assessments at days 3, 8, 15 and 29 post-Baseline. 20 of 21 patients returned for final safety assessments was at 57 days post-Baseline.

group.title: Treatment With BSCT
group.description: BSCT (anti-nf-P2X7) 10% Ointment topically applied twice daily for 28 consecutive days

event.description: Subject 01-007 experienced a myocardial infarction from 9 September 2013 (Study Day 49) to 11 September 2013 (Study Day 51), which was moderate and was considered to be unrelated to study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
